page.title: 14Retford's Canal
page.content: The{Chesterfield Canal}was completed in 1777.The canal used to link Shireoaks and Worksop to Retford and the river Trent at Stockwith. Its chief purpose was to transport coal from Derbyshire pits.Mudford's of Retford make canvas tents today and are a present day link with the hop,sail-cloth,tile-making and gravel industries of the past. {Grove Mill}dates from 1838 and has functioned as maltkiln and flour mill.It will soon be converted into a Pool Hall. The{Packet Inn}was a passenger stop at Gas House Bridge along a stretch of canal linking{Retford Marina}to the Hop Pole.The hop fields are now gone but their influence remains with the Hop Pole Inn. The{canal is navigable}to Worksop and as far as the Trent Eastwards.
